intro: Elatostema stipitatum, commonly known as the small-leaved elatostema, is a small herbaceous plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related plants. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy surface and small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Elatostema stipitatum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid conditions.
